been honest and state i cannot afford more than 3000 in one go and then send me an email 4 days later  when ive done my absolute best to find an alternative place to deal with my cat

leave the cat outside to which i asked if someone else could and i was refused this option my cat could have been seen this morning had i not been refused help for a sick animal and she is now on her way to the rspca in salford the lady from the rspca called you back to ask if she could take my cat and she was advised i wasnt refused due to isolation i was refused due to no staff but you had staff for the 20 to 11 emergency appointment i was given in the first phone call if you would have allowed me to have someone else bring her to the door  i was told i could not bring my cat as she may have covid on her which is utterly ridiculous do your staff not attend the supermarket the gym pubs restaurants there is more risk in your staff attending these places than their is me having someone who does not have covid leave my cat outside so she can get the care she needs a few hours after i was denied help by yourselves we discovered she had missing teeth and had possibly been ran over to lie to the rspca about denying my cat help is appalling to deny an animal help in general is against your duty of care as a veterinary practice a hospital would not refuse a person so why would a vet refuse an animal if my child was seriously ill and needed emergency care a doctor would not refuse to see them because their mum had covid they would be struck off as a vet how is this any different for animals to penalise animals because an owner is having to isolate is disgusting and possibly life threatening  all the calls are recorded for training and monitoring purposes so you can bring that telephone conversation up and discuss amongst yourselves how you are going to deal with situations like this again going forward hopefully in a more caring and professional manor  my cat has been delayed care for 8 hours including the time it has taken the rspca who are doing their jobs correctly to collect my cat and take her to their vet in salford  if anything happens to her having been delayed the care i will hold you personally responsible and advise you train your staff and management on how to deal with isolation and animal emergencies we have been in this pandemic for nearly 2 years i think you are due a training day this should not happen to anyone having to isolate with a sick pet i would not be raising this complaint if i was advised in the first instance you had no staff due to an outbreak of covid within your vet but i was given a time to bring her in and then denied its immoral i then received a phone call after sending the above complaint from the lady who took this complaint very personally as the first thing she said was let me just say this first i am not a liar and began to raise her voice at me not letting me speak was very rude the complaint was addressed to a manager not the customer care advisor i got a bad attitude from someone in a customer care role  red flag she mockingly said you didnt even know your cat had been ran over she denied my i recently went to the vet for pets at 21 23 kings rd sutton coldfield to show them a video of my dog a pug that i believe  has kennel cough the reason why i didnt take her is that the last time she went there was for her course of injections that i paid upfront for when she was a pup that cost over 100 however she only had 3 injections as the vet refused to give her the fourth one unless she was sudated as she hated going to the vets she was stressed out and would take days to recover i said so you want to give her an injection so that you can give her an injection he replied possibly yes which i felt would stress her out even more so we could not complete the course however today i asked them to view a recording my dog that i think has kennel cough the secretaries refused without even consulting the vet and said no the vet needs to exam the dog i told her i dont have a problem with paying for a vet to look at the recording exslained what had happened last time but she said the vet needs to look at the dog just incase something else is wrong i know for a fact this is possible as my daughter showed a recording of her dog that is a staff as at the time she had no way of getting the dog there the vet looked at the recording made a diagnoses then they went and paid when they collected the medication so it is obvious its because they could charge more for the vet to look at the dog i would have understood it if the vet looked at the video then said they need to see the dog so just like the injections i had already paid for they found another way of making a charge up ie to sudate the dog to complete the prepaid service

the portsmouth branch on binnacle way is a completely unprofessional veterinary practice  i initially called in mid may to enquire whether my dog can have her anal glands expressed as my vet was fully booked for another few days to which the receptionist advised that my dog will need to be registered with the practice so i went ahead and registered we have just moved so this is the closest practice anyways i spelled out my name using the phonetic alphabet to make sure no mistakes are made as the spelling of my name is complicated once registered the receptionist only decided to tell me then that in order for my dog to be seen she will need to have a checkup which will cost an additional 45 as she is new to the practice so 67 in total when she only needed her anal glands doneand her last checkup was in feb so she wasnt even due one rather than advising me about this extra cost prior to registering and querying whether i would rather go to the vets i was registered with as then that extra cost would be avoided  as embarrassing as it is i think most people are struggling financially so this was completely immoral and i felt as if ive been scammed i then had to book appointment for my dog to be seen as she needed a prescription so i called and organised an appointment for today 030623  0835 i got there early at 0825 and daisy was second in line to be seen but the receptionist told me that the vet was running late  at around 0845 the receptionist came over to advise that there was a system mishap and the vet was not scheduled to start until 9am at around 0915 the first dogs was seen and then at around 0945 daisy was finally called into the room  1 hour 15 minutes after our allocated appointment i was in the room for around 10 minutes i asked for the prescription and the vet also recommended antihistamines which he said were just over 11 for 5 days to which i agreed when i left the room i was asked to wait until the prescription was readythis was so that i could get her meds online when i finally got the prescription i checked and saw that my forename surname and dogs age was completely wrong which i highlighted to the receptionist who then had to change the prescription causing further delay my dogs dob is august 2014 and they miraculously came up with september 2016 and as mentioned when registering i spelled out my name using the phonetic alphabet to ensure no mistakes are made had i not noticed this the prescription would have been rejected and my dog wouldve had to wait far longer to receive her medication when i finally got the prescription with the correct details on it they failed to add the antihistamines that i asked for  the receptionist asked the vet about this and he said that he thought i didnt want them as they were 13 when he clearly gave me a price just over 11 and i clearly advised at the end of the appointment that i would like them also to which he confirmed as the price difference was not much i advised again that i would like these and the receptionist asked me to sit down and wait whilst this got organised at this point the level of unprofessionalism incompetency and complete disregard to the inconvenience caused to me and my dog my blood started to boil and i advised to just forget about it and to take the payment so that i can leave  i left at 1017 1 hour and 47 minutes after my allocated appointment  not once was i offered an apology nevermind compensation for the terrible service and inconvenience  the appointment was specifically booked for early morning whilst it was still cool outside to avoid the heat when walking to and from the appointment as i do not own a vehicle i hope this detailed review will allow for others to make an informed decision when considering registering their beloved pet with this practice

my cat lala is most likely poisoned by one of my garden plants it is a young cat who likes to hunt insects i have seen many times how together with the fly she caught a piece of the soft plant in her mouth i have checked the plants in my garden and there are a minimum of ten of them that are poisonous to cats i wanted to start lalas tests in this direction ie take a vomit sample and urine for analysis or at least discuss this test direction unfortunately my observations and fears were ignored i was told to continue with the next tests that were discussed with the vet earlier ie a scan and xray from the research that has been done so far many diseases have been ruled out another examination to be carried out is a scan and an xray looking for objects i understand that the vet wants to rule out as many causes of lalas malaise as possible but what i dont understand is why the vet is not taking the owners observations and opinion into account its been ten days since lala is ill i suspect the vet are not prepared for cats that have poisoned themselves with plants id only rather be honestly informed about it than ignored another thing is that lalas fur has been shaved in three places to take a blood sample  another thing which i will also mention is that after the sterilization operation the cat was bleeding from the reproductive organs for three weeks which is a dangerous side effect of sterilization  i am very sorry to give such a low mark to this clinic because very nice people work there but i am even more sorry to look at the complications and suffering of my cat

i dont even know where to start  i think it is every pets owner worse nightmare to take their pet basically family member to the vets and to then not return with them but it happens we know animals have to get put down sometimes  however we took my cat in thursday 275 in the morning to be neutered a simple procedure we had an update few hours later saying he is fine we then get a call saying our cat milo has somehow ended up in the ceiling of the vets the fire brigade has been called and couldnt get him down as the ceiling structure isnt strong enough  initially this was quite funny as its just such a typical cat thing however it then dawned on us why is there a hole in the ceiling in the recovery room its common knowledge cats seek higher surfaces as it makes them feel safer its also a vets surely a ferret bird other animal could so easily do the same thing   i was at work during all of this but my dad goes to the vets at their closing time as they still havent been able to retrieve him when he gets there theyre somewhat apologetic and dad has a look for himself and is unable to find milo they then say theyve laid a trap and going to hopefully trap him and grab him but that theyve got to shut the vets  i cannot believe that after they lost our cat through negligence and lack of health and safety that they would then be happy to go home knowing a family has to go to bed without their pet they were happy to shut the vets and leave a cat stranded in the ceiling  it is currently the morning where i still dont have my cat and i am absolutely mortified that we would take my cat in for a simple procedure and the vet lost my cat  not to state the obvious but we also pay our yearly fee with the vet and for the procedure etc so i just want to understand exactly what are we paying for them

yesterday i took molly my little shi tzu the baby of my 3 for a rather big operation hysterectomy hernia and she also had a small lump removed from next to her nipple she went in for 90am and thats when i and the family were on pins all day waiting to bring her home again 530pm seemed to take for ever to come around molly came out with the nurse she looked ok but she did look tired but well last night she didnt want to eat but she was drinking plenty of water throughout the nightbut today she is full of life again eating chicken and loving it she crys to come out the cage for a wee etc all i can say about the vets is that they took really good care of her when you enter the vets you can see how clean it is and there is no animal smell you can get in some practice the staff are very nice also the receptionist are very helpful nothing is to much trouble it was a good experience for molly and i thank you so much for everything
the service was very good during the covid situation and the treatment that our cat received meant that she recovered from surgery quickly because of the excellent after care thank you

i went to this vets at the end of december as my puppy was licking his feet i explained at length that this had started some 3 weeks before but had gradually got worse and said id purchased my pup some 56 months earlier with no issues it turned out that the condition was linked to an allergy i asked about getting blood tests to find the route of the condition i contacted my insurance company animal friends to authorise a pre authorisation for treatment it turns out the vet david had written in his notes that my pup had the condition since i purchased him which was never said and never the case now my insurance company will not cover my pup for any condition linked to allergies because the vet david was incompetent and wrote incorrect information in my notes you would think if he wasnt sure what was said he would have checked the aftercare was really poor also with david avoiding my calls and the reception staff promising to call back and never doing so please for your own sake and that of your pets look elsewhere for a reputable vets i have know taken my pup to malvern in north cheam and they are fantastic

portsmouth vets ripped me off a treat my dog went in 2 weeks ago for routine c section as didnt go into labour naturally only 1 pup surgery ended in her being spayed for her best interests and pup died 20 minutes after i brought him home not good when you got a 7 year old at home who was distraught cut a long story short 1st post check up everything fine 2nd a bit of bleeding from private parts given more antibiotics not even 24 hours later my dog had to be put to sleep as she had internal bleeding and more or less bled to deaf i was absolutely devastated surly this should of been picked up the day before on examination all i can say for 1700 over the course of 2 weeks i came out with nothing no puppy and most gutting of all no mother dog either i feel failed buy this vet and will never use them again if i went else wear im sure my dog would still be alive today should these complications happen after 2 weeks maybe not if it was done properly in the 1st place ongoing from response not once was i told this was going to be complicated surgery and was only spade as it was recommended whilst dog was in surgery im not stupid as i work in a medical profession myself maybe if more attention was took in 2 week post op examination whilst dog was bleeding slightly this wouldnt of happened the next day instead given antibiotics clearly not an infection that was the problem my dog was 3 years old fit and healthy before she came to you within 2 weeks shes dead so i wont be contacting you but i will be making an formal complaint as i want some justice for my girl for your cock ups

i am totally disappointed at the service provided by the vet nottingham in bilborough and the way its staff wanted to handle this issue is absolutely unprofessional we took our dog to the vet nottingham in bilborough on monday because our dog was screaming from pain the vet said that the dog has a problem with his knee cap that was the reason why he was under a lot of pain he got painkillers onlythe next day the dog was still crying from pain and he was very weak he could hardly walk he couldnt eat and drink i was trying to give him water with a syringe trying to find out what caused this pain and that was when i noticed that there is a huge wound on his neck photo attached i was called today by one of the staff members and the way she wanted to handle this issue is absolutely outrageous 1 she told me that it was our fault that we failed to see the wound under the collar not the doctors 2 she said that the doctor did not see the wound because it was not there 3 she said that the wound must have been so small that the collar covered totally covered it that is why the doctor didnt notice this this is not true the diameter of the wound is approximately 3 cms the collar is 1 cm wide if the vet had taken a look at the dogs neck he would have noticed it 4 then she accused us of shaving the skin around the wound that is why it looks so big in the photo that i had sent her i told her that it is absolutely not true how could i have shaved a pusser a very bad wound it is absolutely impossible 5 i told her that i want to take the dog to her immediately so she can see the wound and prove to her the we were not lying but she refused she did not want to see the dog i asked her several times to please take a look at it but she didnt let me go there 6 the doctor failed to notice the wound however he spent quite a long time explaining my husband what my dog needs xray operation heart checkup medication etc i wish he had concentrated more on examining my dog than the finances 7 however the doctor knew that our 10yearold dog has serious heart problems he still insisted on a surgery he must know  even i know and i am not a vet  that it is very risky to put such an old dog with serious heart conditions to sleep before surgery in conclusion i am totally dissatisfied with the vet nottinghams service and the way they wanted to handle this issue we would have deserved an apology for all this but instead the staff member who called us today blamed us and wanted to make us feel bad for not noticing the wound and accused us for shaving the skin around the wound to make it look bigger i do not recommend the vet nottingham in bilborough to anyone ps they did not even apologise i would also like to mention that the staff member who called me asked me to remove my previous bad review in return for her help which i did but then i didnt get any help instead i was blamed for not noticing the wound on my dogs neck and accused of lying

i want to let people know what happened to us when we took a stray cat that was known to us and had been independently living around us for a while  when i say independently he came to us if he was hungry or needed shelter in one of the outside sheds  he didnt want to stay in the house with our other pets but enjoyed a cuddle now and again but he liked his independence which we respected  the cat in question was injured recently so we phoned the rspca who advised us to take the cat to a vet and they would pay for the treatment  when my partner and my 15yr old daughter who had become very attached to the cat took him to the vet they were met with 2 options either they handed the cat over to them or we had to take financial responsibility for the cat  we were told an xray was required and that would be between 300 and 400 pounds and then if an operation was required it would be in excess of 150000p there was no possibility that we could find that particularly during this covid19 period   we do not claim benefits so cannot get help with this sort of thing   the staff were very impatient and wanted to close thus putting pressure on my partner to make a choice and leave  my daughter was in pieces  my partner offered to take on a payment plan in order to make the payments but they wanted payment up front before any care could be given but they also refused to give the cat back to my partner  so they had to leave the cat and my daughter was broken hearted i called the next day and spoke to a member of staff of which i do have that persons name but do not wish to disclose as i intend to make a formal complainti was advised they were going to contact a cat charity and get funding to do the necessary treatment i asked what would happen if she couldnt secure funding from the pet charities that they have contact with and she said they have a large amount of charities they can contact and that they have never had that problem  i asked why they had not called the rspca as they would pick the cat up and take it to one of their hospitals and carry out the necessary treatment  i was advised that they do not use the rspca as they find them unreliable i was also told that after funding was secured from one of the pet charities the cat would go to the charity for them to rehouse  i offered to adopt the cat and to take out pet insurance for him as i have my existing dog and cat  she said she would give me the name of the charity once she had secured funding and it would be up to them  thats all fine i thought  i called back the following day this particular member of staff was off but i was told by a nurse that xrays had been done and they had been sent off to an orthopedic surgeon i asked which charity had financially supported the care but the nurse said i needed to speak with my previous contact and she would be able to tell me  i called back today to be told by that member of staff who was rather less helpful than the last time i had spoken with her to be told that she could not divulge too much information about the cat  and that basically she couldnt get funding which she had previously advised me would not be no problem what so ever and that they were going to carry out the care themselves and then either one of the nurses or vet would keep the cat or they would rehome the cat elsewhere which in her expert opinion was the best thing for it which astounds me as i think we know the stray better than they do  and surely putting it back in its original environment is better than having to rehabilitate it to a new environment  she told me the cat was very settled and happy  however the cat is in pain and on painkillers so i have been led to believe but im not sure about that now so they are not seeing the cat in its more usual environment  eg he doesnt like doors being closed on him he likes to come and go as he pleases but likes a stroke now and again  i feel that we have been misled and that there could be another agenda going on here i cannot even express how upset my daughter is and i havent even told her about the conversation ive had with this member of staff today  i gave my daughter false hope based on a conversation with whom i thought was a caring member of staff im going to lodge a formal complaint with the md of this company following this despicable behavior but that wont take away the sense of loss and hurt we are all feeling right now

do not use this vet  they are more interested in taking your money than looking after your pet  me and my girlfriend have came to this vet numerous times as our cat was suffering from giardia a stomach parasite that can be fatal if not treated  we paid hundreds in vet bills to run tests on her stool samples and even more for the treatment we were quickly racking up a bill that we were struggling to fund to look after our cat our cat got better for about a month and then went back to having a constant runny bum weeping eyes and a very poorly cat once again  after going back to the vet nottingham a couple of weeks ago we were told she needs more tests run on her to find the issue once again around 200 we explained we cannot physically afford it insurance would not cover her and we were afraid and upset that we might have to get our 1yearold cat put down we were once again given some eye drops and worming treatment 76 including the consultation  as a last resort we decided to get a second opinion at the animal doctor in ravenshead never been before after getting our cat checked out they said looking over your previous history the vet nottingham hasnt actually treated your cat for giardia we could not actually believe what we were hearing the vet went on to explain the correct treatment and why she has not gotten better because our poor cat still has this nasty parasite she was given a steroid shot some antibiotics some prebiotics and some other tablets that will help her get better including the consultation this came to 88 which shows you how overpriced the vet nottingham is the vet could see how upset we were of the service we were given for our cat and even explained that we could pay at a later date to help us financially they offered to split the bill down so it was more manageable for us and were only interested in helping our cat  we will never step foot in the vet nottingham again and i advise you stay well away  they only want your money we feel we have been taken advantage of as a young couple in desperate need of help for their cat  you should all be ashamed and should not be allowed to call yourselves a vet  disgusting

we visited the vets today with our 3 dogs was met by friendly receptionist who seated us and explained what was happening covid19 procedures was excellent t saw vet he was really caring had joined the pet health care plan and would recommend this

a year ago while i was on holiday my dogs carers had to rush him to the vet morden after he had swallowed a plum the vet took xrays and said that they could see the plum seed and that they needed to operate to remove itafter cutting my dog open they realised that it was not a plum seed it was his food maybe if they had asked the question wether he had just been fed or not this could of been avoidable 15000 later and a very unhappy dog and a meeting with the vet whos excuse was it was a matter of life or death we decided not to use this vet again unfortunately a couple of weeks ago my dog became really ill and as i had moved just before lockdown and hadnt had the chance to register my dogs at another vets i reluctantly took him back to the vet mordeni explained how ill he was and how worried we were they gave me some worming treatment and told me to change his diet and to come back on monday for blood testsi took him back 2 days later for blood tests and explained how worried i was and that he was not any better they didnt give me any advise or any idea of what could be wrong with him just told to me wait for resultsi contacted another vet for a second opinion she saw me straight away and what a completely different experience it was she noticed my dog was very unwell as soon as she saw him and she gave him some pain killers and anti inflammatory meds she then referred us to the super vet fitzpatricks as she could see how much pain he was in she even called me later that evening to make sure he was okmy dog has now been diagnosed with a slipped disc and my new vet calls every now and then to make sure hes ok this sort of care would never of happened at the vet mordeni will never take another animal of mine to this vets all they are interested in is money money money and i dont believe that their prices are competitive anymore as they advertisetry another vets youll be surprised as there are vets out there that actually care about animals

i had to book an emergency appointment today and i must say i am very impressed and based on that the vet will become my primary vet for the care of my 4 dogs  one of my dogs has suddenly developed a severe allergic reaction is sunday and i rushed to call my standard vet who directed me to the emergency clinic i waited for over an hour in the car park waiting to be seen in this heat with a very sick baby and there still were many cars before me  he started panting i had no water and kept the car running keeping the air con going the swelling of the allergy seemed to star getting better but my poor baby wasnt doing well and while waiting i remembered that at some point i used the vet before and although my dog was not registered decided to call them amazing response they asked me to get there within 20 minutes as i arrived he swiftly was collected from my car and treated the vet was amazing so friendly and caring he is now recovering at home and the bill was quarter of what i was told in the emergency clinic i would have to pay overall a great experience thank you to the vet team for taking such a good care of my baby so swiftly and so professional i definitely will see you more often  thanks
quality of service has disappeared lack of communicationwill be looking for a new vet

i have had many dealings with the vet bristol and have always been pleased with the service outcomes and recommendations the staff are generally quite friendly but briony who always greets and goes out of her way to deliver the best for clients in particular stands out as does the vet sandra however following an extremely bad ear infection and ear flush i have been left  sadly with a feeling of a lack of care and understanding of how my elderly cocker spaniel has been suffering i called the vet with concerns of her distress after the ear flush she was experiencing constant head shaking crying pus oozing and unable to settle only to be told there is  nothing that can be done until until lab results were back this was thurs am and was told lab results back monday hannah on reception spoke to a vet and relaid those comments and came back to me saying she had made notes but nothing further could be done at this point my dear dog continued to show severe signs of distress so i called back and was told a vet would call me back as at the very least i am sure she could have been given some pain relief until the results came back but i waited and no call came i am sat hear watching my dog in a clear state of pain i have now been left saddened angry and disappointed at this disgusting lack of concern or care for my beloved dog especially after the amount of money that has been spent on a service  once this is sorted i will be seeking an  alternative vet whom i feel i can rely on with more confidence and care for my dear elderly little lady please consider these comments when making your choice for your beloved pet

awful and incompetent i really dont think anyone has a clue about the most basics including the vet our puppy was booked in for his vaccinations  all information including the vaccine and dates were given to the practice took our dog and the vet wouldnt vaccinate him said it had gone over 4 weeks felt pressured into having him re vaccinated  also charged for  after speaking  to the breeders vet for advice and using the internet to research  after zero confidence with the vet was told he absolutely could of been vaccinated with  nobivac so now weve paid 55 for something he didnt need and more importantly now we cant take our dog out for another 6 weeks no responsibility taken whatsoever just handed a complaints form
avoid incompetent lazy lacking manners and good time keeping bunch of morons if you do not mind those qualities then go ahead

sadly my greyhound was diagnosed with terminal cancer and the kindness was to let him go jess the vet was superb she demonstrated empathy care and love as i had to hand him over in the car park due to covid 19 i rescued another greyhound who needed castration and teeth cleaning jess rang me herself to say how happy she was for me and to tell me how beautiful raffy is and what a good boy he was this vet is outstanding the rest of the staff nurses and manager have also been superb at supporting me through all of this i recommend this practice to all thank you to all the staff at portsmouth but especially jess i hope i wont need to see you again soon

our dog needed emergency surgery to her womb during the lockdown we dealt with other vets recently but all the staff here went way above and beyond to make sure we fully understood every step that needed to be taken helped organise a payment plan due to to work needed to be done we dealt with the vet named aurora and shes absolutely brilliant in what she does we wont go anywhere else after visiting here

update  to the vet response i had been going longer to this groomers then they are stating and no one contacted me to update my appointments as i have previously stated i had to ring back up to try and get another appointment to be put at back of queue always took sweets in after my dog was groomed and further recommended to other dog lovers i understand they had one groomer and hannah was good with louie i am not disputing this just messed about so many times and left with no update appointments  i had been going the vet in liverpool for over 3 yrs and my dog louie was so used to being groomed here by hannah the groomer my appointments started getting cancelled a lot and i would have to chase these up as no one rang me back i was then put at the back of the queue and after the 6 weeks of previously waiting i would further have to wait up to another 6 weeks for my dog to be groomed again i was always lovely to hannah and would take her sweets in on our visits i feel we were badly let down i now groom my dog louie myself as i have now bought all the equipment i need along with the grooming table i felt it would be unfair to louie to introduce him to another groomer as he was with hannah a long time and he was used to her whats most disappointing is that hannah had mentioned she had formed a bond with louie

the people who work at the surgery in ashton are so caring i cannot recommend them enough  my large american bulldogstaffie max doesnt like going to the vets at all  he is very fearful and reactive but due to some unfortunate mishaps and had to attend for treatment several times  due to her patience and kindness he has struck up a friendship with one of the nurses vicki and so she sees him every time he attends and liaises with the vets usually carlotta who understands max so well and does what is best for him not what is best for her  vicki is extremely competent professional and caring  he was attacked by another dog and had a deep wound and so i booked an appointment online  vicki called me to ask if i could take him in at a different time as she wasnt there for the original appointment and she wanted to make his visit as stressfree as possible for him  she knows he reacts to most other people in the surgery due to being frightened  he had to be sedated so that she could treat the wound and she said it would be best for my dog if i could stay with him to reassure him  she injected him after spending 20 minutes with him settling him down then put blankets down on the floor and left just him and i in the room for him to relax and go to sleep  she treated the deep wound and then allowed me to stay with him until he came round  she was taking leave for a week and said to send pictures or a video to the vets instead of bringing him in as it would be stressful for him if she wasnt there which the vet agreed with  she also said that if he had to come back with any complications whilst she was away that the surgery should call her and she would pop in and settle him  how cool is that  i forgot to take his medication away with me and so had to go back next day  i took max in as it was quiet and carlotta came out to see how his was from a distance even though she had clients booked in  just amazing

been with this vet for over 2 years and really happy with the service provided  im always made welcome and my dog is always dealt with promptly and a full explaination provided  love the offer of drop in and appointments  would definitely recommend

had the most horrendous experience after a vet perforated my dogs eardrum during routine examination eventually resulting in him having his ear canal removed when making a complaint i was told i had no evidence and because id asked the vet to look in my dogs ear they tried to state he had a pre existing condition i had only taken him that day as hed had some dental work and this was a check up i mentioned i noticed he was shaking his head the day before so could she give him a check over during the examination i was told no damageperforation to my dogs ear i have to say i left feeling upset that day and spoke about it to the receptionist on my way out the vet had asked me to help her hold my dog down as he was screaming after she inserted instruments and a cotton bud in his ear hes a pug and very tolerant usually so was worried she had really hurt him she administered some drops incase of any infection which i gave that night and the next morning the next day i found my dog lying in vomit  diarreah he couldnt walk and his head was at a tilt i thought he had had a stroke i rushed back to the vets where i was told his eardrum was perforated right in the middle this was where the vet had inserted a cotton bud the ear drops had entered his middle ear and had caused him to be off balance i spoke to the manager about this and she advised me to get back in touch when everything had resolved my dog had treatment for months but we could see the deterioration during this time i had to chase for results for more medication nobody returned my calls and on one occasion i was told by a vet in her experience she had never seen a dog recover from similar issues and to prepare myself to put him out of his misery after a particularly bad experience of seeing my dogs head fill with an abscess and double in size we made the decision to have his ear canal removed my dog is obviously now deaf he walks off balance with a head tilt its just devastating i have had no apology or offer of help with the 10k cost i used this vets since they opened in 2016 so absolutely devastated with their response i will not be taken my pets their again

i bought a puppy who had his check up here according to his breeder and he had his first injections here too i have the card with the details i picked up the puppy the same day as his check up and took him home he had a raging ear infectiin and he was continuously scratching his ear and crying it cost me 140 for the vets including an ear scraping to determine what type of infection he had then ear cleaner and antibiotics left untreated could have caused deafness 4 weeks later i go back to my vet who tells me that they have to restart his vacines as the one given at the vetcouk was a cheaper vaccine which only covers 2 diseases instead of the recomended 4 it shows that you get what you pay for cheaper vets where you dont need an appointment should tell you to go elsewhere my vet is excellent and you need to book in advance steer clear of places like this were you can walk in off the street and recieve cheap treatment you would be better burning your money and your pet will be much happier and healthy

august 2018 pea size lump spotted on lily my westie when she had her booster vaccination constant visits made to vets regarding her whining pining pulling claws out told she may have behavioural issues inflacam prescribed i said shes in pain has diarrhoea constantly by september 9th i see a discharge so yet again return to vet emergency hysterectomy done i had to keep insisting to please check theres discharge now she wasnt spayed she had pea size lump on mammary gland thanks to your incompetence my lily died four weeks ago in pain mammary tumours as a result of pyrometra do your vets know to check for this in female dogs not spayed do you refer to historical computerised data on file learn from this and never will i ever return with any animal to your practice
cant speak highly enough about my recent visit to the practice warm friendly atmosphere and care top class would recommend

absolutely brilliant teamsadly we had to put our loved dog sam to sleep last week and all the team from receptionists to vet was absolutely fab with us during such painful moment in our lifethey let us to say goodbye properly and gave us all the supportfrom the bottom of our hearts thank you maite

little sooty is one of our rescue cats via rspca who needed dental work to remove 5 teeth and treatment for a nasty dose of gum disease he was looked after exceptionally well and at his ten day post op meeting with the nurse was given the all clear both us and sooty couldnt be happier   the care to both the animal and owners is fantastic the pricing policy is clear and fair you dont feel like you are being ripped off like other surgeries  hoping that they will be opening a centre in the orpingtonkent area in the future as we are looking to move next year and i would love to continue using this company hint hint
excellent service and very helpful and friendly vets and nurses love the pets very good with the dog
the best vet practice ever recommend to every dog and cat owner i know staff are lovely
i have always had good treatment by friendly staff and the costs are never over the topi have just booked my dog in for an operation and have every confidence that he will be well cared for
great service and very friendly staff love the ability to walk in or choose an appointment to suit
the vet are fantastic cheerful helpful fair priced and dedicated to each pet xxxxx

my puppy snapped her tooth phoned the vet told them what had happened  they told me to come right down an someone will see her was seen to straight away an booked in for an operation the next day great service an excellent staff very friendly
visited for first time  was a very pleasant and welcoming experience  vet was extremely helpful and informative and so we all staff  i would highly recommend the vet in port solent

i took my gerbil the vet today as he was very unwell and was moving very orientated and i went to the liverpool vet and got seen straight away the vet was very gentle and caring with him and she gave me a few options on what to do i could take him to rutlands or he would be put to sleep and i decided to put him to rest and she was very caring towards me as this was a difficult time i could not fault the vet or reception team as they were really supportive towards me as i found it so hard to deal with as my other gerbil had just passed away they offered me drinks and water and i couldnt thank them enough for their thoughtful service and i would highly recommend them to anyone

i frequently have to visit the surgery with my two dogs and sometimes i do have to wait quite a long time to be seen  however this is purely down to someones pet needing urgent or time consuming treatment  appointments are available as a walk in system isnt for everyone but again delays can occur as emergencies happen and some pets need to be seen immediately  to me this is a small price to pay for a caring and expert knowledge experience  i would rather have to wait than have a very hurried appointment

the vet nottingham has been my go to vet practice for 2 years now the staff have always been friendly and welcoming the practice is clean with drinks and treats to have while you are waiting and you do get welcomed into the practice like you are one of the family the length this practice have gone to to save my rabbits life is amazing and you can tell that every staff member cares deeply for their patients i can see this being my go to vets forever

great vets practice very friendly and courteous staff practice hours are great and an appointment is not always necessary would definitely recommend both our dogs attend this practice and the care they receive is fantastic

fantastic vet all the staff who i have met have been really lovely and helpful they remember my pets and always make time for us the grooming parlour in there is so good as wellmy little dog loves going to her love the fact you get text reminders for boosters health checks etcreasonable pricing i would highly recommend
always been a pleasant experience when visiting the vet the waiting area is large and has been a calm atmosphere even when busy i picked this vet because of the price transparency no hidden surprises

my visits over the past 4 years to the vet in southampton have always been good  they saved my cats life when she accidentally ingested rat poison the vets have always been friendly and their advice has always been great until today sitting in reception waiting for my cat to have her annual boosters i hear the receptionist speaking to numerous clients on the phone about flea treatments i hear her telling one client well you can get something from a shop but it isnt very strong chemically so you can come and make an appointment with us and get something thats better and stronger and a second one is told from a shop it only works a couple of times and after that because there are no chemicals it just doesnt work anymore this is incorrect and as a pet store manager in the industry for 15 years and an sqp for the last 10 years is misinformation im sadly all too used to hearing when i got in to see the vet i asked him if the receptionists were sqp trained to be giving this advice to clients as i was concerned more people are being told the wrong thing and worrying about what they are using on their pet he did not answer this and instead started to argue with me about products such as frontline and bob martin he said that bob martin kills cats and that frontline does not work anymore and should only be used on very young kittens as they dont need the product to be that strong i told him that it does and if it did not work then surely it shouldnt be sold anymore he said that the bugs have all developed resistance and compared these products to antibiotic resistance i asked about seresto a product which vets have rated and recommended for years and now due to further proven safety has been recently changed so that sqps in pet stores can now sell it and he said the same thing about the resistance to the ingredients the majority of the time products not working as expected is due to user error  either 1 the product was appliedadministered incorrectly or for the wrong weight of animal 2 not all animals in the home were treated 3 the biggest one  the environment was not treated  only the animals i would suggest that as the face of your business your receptionists receive some correct training on these products  especially during high demand in this warmer weather and also that your vet ines ilic receives firstly some customer service training on how not to be rude and argue with a client secondly how to handle a cat that is nervous and how to show any shred of care towards her and thirdly to do his research so that he is not scaremongering clients who will always trust their vets and also to ensure that he  and yourselves  do not end up subject to a court case for slander by these companies he is slating

the veterinary hospital camberwelli would give the staff and vets more stars as they are good but the prices are virtually beyond reach  be aware they are part of the medivet group which seems to be taking over all the independent vets  another medivet vets wanted to charge 800 for two xrays on my cats leg whereas my old vet  which thank goodness is still independent  quoted 168   please try and support the independent vets as they are fast disappearing to the onslaught of medivet who seem to charge around 400 more

we would like to thank all of the vets team hoping that they will continue to be so dedicated to their work all the professionals of the clinic are brilliant especially dr zoe who always attends our lia maria with a lot of love
love these people they really look after you excellent service and very pet friendly i have recommended my friends to them superb service icanot say a bad word against them

we have been using the vet warrington for the last 2 years we decided to try it as our previous vets had become expensive and it was difficult to get appointments that suited us were glad we changed  the walkin facility is great as we work shifts the reception area is a clean large space with separate areas for cats and dogs we think the pricing is reasonable and most importantly our pets have always received a high level of care  the staff are always friendly and greet you with a smile we would highly recommend this practice
excellent modern practice with very reasonable prices would thoroughly recommend

amazing vets with a team that really care about our girls recently moved and had to change vets was advised to go to the vet in ashton and i am so pleased i did molly had injections today with no problem and megan had a check after having a poorly ear and cyst both looking really good now thanks to the amazing work by carlotta apologises if spelt incorrectly wonderful customer care manager craig who immediately makes you at ease and really cares about all pets thank you very much to everyone  two very happy westies

our dog had gone lame on one leg and we were sent away with anti inflammatories and rest and if not x rays of the hips and stifle would be needed as noted in his medical notes we were giving the cost for this of 380 a few days later peanut deteriorated again so we booked in for the x rays when i handed him over there was converation about the price and it may be more if they need to x ray elsewhere i agreed to this and said the hips and stifles will need doing so we can be sure what the problem is i also said i wasnt 100 happy with him being put under a general anesthetic and asked for possible sedation  this was at 805am in the morning it then got to nearly 6pm and i was worried sick so had to call them myself several times before finally getting through and i could go and collect him when i arrived payment was taking and i sat and waited to be called in when i collected him i asked for the outcome but there was no vet available to speak to or look at the x rays they couldnt even tell me what they had x rayed i left with a dog non weight bearing on his leg 380 poorer and no explanation i then had to wait till 3pm the following day for a vet to call me and they didnt x ray his stifles at this point i was fuming as our dog is a risky breed to be going under again we returned the following day and saw another vet which we had to pay for so another consultation fee and medication and he was unable to tell us what was wrong with our dog without being sent for an mri scan thankfully 4 weeks on our dog is back to normal and must of been something minor in the end also dont bother complaining as they call your dog by the wrong name and basically call you a lair regarding any conversations you have has with the vets there if you go make sure you write everything down and get them to sign it although you shouldnt have to when you are paying good money for a service would just like to add the staff on reception are lovely when we returned to see the vet again there was nearly a two hour wait and we had children with us they kindly got us hot drinks for the wait

we went to this vets in waltham forest for the first time today and liked the big and clean reception area my only criticism would be that the pop music being played was a bit loud which may not be great for nervous pets the coffee machine was out of water but thats a minor issue and easily resolved the actual vet visit went very well the vet listened and asked pertinent questions and our cat bobby got the treatment he needed the fees charged were super reasonable we will come back here again recommended

nearly 12 months from my dog having an accident and not getting the treatment promised from the vet i have received a letter stating according to there records i owe them 90 quid yet the insurance paid out and i paid the excess and the dog hasnt been near this shambles of a practice since so why do i owe money i had nothing but trouble from this practice and vet and now you are still haunting me 11 months later

i took my cat to the vet i am registered i was told all the appointments were booked for a week and to come at walk in times your website states 0 minute waiting time and if you read the about us it claims how great the vet is as you can walk in at anytime the receptionist didnt even ask what i wanted sadly not very caring the vetsnurses are great when you can eventually get to see them

walk in appointments walk in disappointments is more like it and this is not the first time please do had on your site the information that for a simple boost of rabies vaccine one needs to book an appointment 1 week in advanceit would have saved me the useless trip down the waste of time and it would have avoid cookie a lot of stress

this is an excellent veterinary practice very professional and also friendly to pets and owners always efficient in dealing with appointments medication etc walkin or booked appointment available and long practice hours suit most work schedules they have helped solve a problem for one of my cats for a fraction of the cost charged by another local practice just for investigations highly recommended
absolutely the best choice i cannot praise them enough our chalky has had 2 operations and has been looked after as tho he was one of their own pets
absolutely fantastic caring and friendly letting us know what is going on with our doggies and not fobbing us off

my dog had a bad tooth that became infected  she was given a course of antibiotics and pain killers and a appointment for a weeks time to take out the bad tooth and clean and polish  the infection cleared up really fast and painkillers worked for her  took her in for the tooth extraction and when i picked her up i was surprised to learn they had taken 6 teeth out  im very satisfied as i didnt have a clue about the other 5 teeth that were bad  i feel another vet could have had me keep going back to get 1 tooth out at a time and cost me so much more  i would recommend this vet to everybody i know and anyone looking on the internet for a vet  staff are great  ive never had a problem
i find the staff are extremely helpful every time ive taken my animals to them i feel that they cant seem to do enough for you what ever the situation may be
i cannot rate the vet in warrington highly enough the service and value for money are second to none i would highly reccomend to anyone

zoe was very professional patient and accommodating  she made our dog at more ease whilst examining and talking to herzoe detected fear aggression and handled this perfectly  we would prefer to see her in future if possible as she is a great asset to your business in chingford

been to this vet in morden a few times some days are really good and helpful and some days are not there is quite a few young staff and receptionists that are quite rude receptionist always huffing and puffing as if its too much for them to work and i get it working in a vet is a stressful environment but its not the customer fault we also are worried and anxious too with our pets so when we come out from the rooms and walk back to the front desk the customers shouldnt have to deal with the rudeness i think a course or staff training needs to be put in to effect as the receptionists need to be more happy to help customers for instance a vet nurse came out to the front to report to the receptionist about my appointment and the receptionist could not be bothered to respond and sighed again when you leave the vets youre deflated thinking why were they so moody with me and what did i do wrong  there was a receptionist called katie who i havent seen in some time in my recent visits she is so rude and horribly spoken i do not know how or why she was allowed to be on the front desk she even made racist remarks to pakistani people  this is supposed to a helpful place passion for animals and i believe the veterinary staff do have this but at times even the student vets cannot be bothered there was even a mix up one time with my pet and they did apologized and said they mixed my pet up with another pet  i just wish the front desk staff would perk up a bit and give people a smile as soon as the customers walk through the front door  a vet even made a big mistake with my friends dog said he broke his foot so she got a second opinion from another vet and it turned out to be a bruise what a big mistake to make so glad my friend got a second opinion otherwise she would of have to payed 500 which the vet told my friend how much it would cost to have her dogs foot repaired  this is also supposed to be a lower price vet clinic than others and it really is not they overcharge on prescriptions and sometimes you cant pay in full as alot of people who attend this vet are on a low income or have struggles and therefore set up a payment plan as i witness a guy do so but they do not like it when you havent got alot of money or pay up front debs the older receptionist was rude to a customer after she mentioned paying half and half the day after and raised her voice and said surely you can pay more than that and katie at the time was sitting next to debs and rolled her eyes  horrible

we highly recommend the vet warrington branch  the whole team  receptionist nurses and vets are very polite caring and professional  we had to take our doberman in 20 mins before closing on friday we werent rushed and the staff stayed and took their time with her we were there for about 2 hours after closing  we were back in on saturday morning with her and saw the same vet  hollie who is lovely again she took her time and was very kind and caring later in the day we also received a call from the vets checking on our girl  we cant thank them enough for the care and attention they gave her

i highly recommend taking any pet to the vets you can check on line app live wait times  the whole team from receptionist nurses and vets are very polite caring and professional  both my cats dolly and bel have been looked after excellently since 1st visit has kittens  i have a pet plan for both my girls so most costs are covered and i would highly recommend this product to anyone with a pet  cant thank them enough for the care and attention they provide my girls  excellent practice

i have quite a long history with the vets well over 1 year ago i had to treat one of my rats and medication prescribed was calculated incorrectly i ignored that as i can rectify that issue myself changed the vet for some time and eventually came back had some successful visits reception team is amazing and very supportive they try to make sure the appointment time suits your personal arrangements and in general are just the most friendly girls i have ever met in different vet practices sadly visiting vets is not about that  i already left one review here to that i actually received a response and i was asked to contact them via email which i did i described all issues in more details that i wanted to rectify however my email was ignored i even emailed again a week ago just to remind adam that is the person who asked me to email the vet that i am still waiting none of my emails were aggressive so i am unsure as to why it was left completely ignored  i absolutely understand that rats are very tricky however my experience with the vet was overall positive so it just upsets me that 2 visits in a row ended up so badly  the first one out of two visits ended up with the vet erik telling me that my clearly ill rat is perfectly fine one week later that rat was put to sleep and i believe that with accurate medication that i am always happy to pay for he could have a few extra weeks with us eriks attitude towards me was not nice but i hope he just had a bad day  it was the second time i have seen him and the first visit was good so i was very surprised to see him disputing every single thing i say example i gave him a syringe with a sample of my rats urine with blood in it clearly red he asked me how do i know he is peeing blood i mean seriously that rat was showing very obvious syptoms of neurological problems  pt unable to hold anything with front paws wobbly losing appetite also showing signs of being in pain  constantly closed eyes ached back puffed fur we left with no medication whatsoever he did prescribe some medication for my other rat  he first offered doxycycline and once i said that i actually have it at home he changed it to trimethoprim  im glad we dont live in a cartoon because i swear he would have dollar signs in his eyes   as for the second visit ive seen iona  she straight away stated that she is not a vet specializing in rats and recommended to go to a completely different practice why waste my time then i always say what pet i am bringing with me so that was something that did concern me on that visit i was putting my rat to sleep the one erik saw before and i asked for medication for my other old rat that is the one peeing blood that erik saw before as well medication from him worked for a few days but my rat didnt take full dose as it was incredibly bitter so i asked for a different one i was told by iona there is none wrong there is baytril but i can give him inflacam i know well enough that inflacam without an antibiotic is pointless not to mention that she actually didnt prescribe it she prescribed some baytril for nebusiler to treat his lungs but in my eyes blood in urine is way more urgent she also advised me to get iv saline solution which i cant get from local pharmacies without a prescription i also gave her a sample of my rats urine to see what is wrong but she did not test it i since took my rats elsewhere and the issue with the blood in urine was fixed within 2 weeks  such a shame because i really liked visiting the vets and i enjoyed little chats with lovely girls in the reception
excellent experience at vets today on lorenzo drive 1st family puppy and got 2nd needle staff were lovely from reception to vet corrin really helpful and great with the dog and us

i cannot recommend highly enough my very own supervet christos in southampton branch after my dachshund was hit by a car and sustained multiple pelvic fractures christos performed the intricate surgery to repair such tiny frail bones dot and her best friend a beagle also hit by the same car have both received amazing care from all the vets nurses and reception staff they have had contract with i have been kept fully informed with detailed explanations and reassurance we now embark on the long road to full recovery but i know both my dogs have been given the best start long waits are a result of too few vets in a very busy practice frequently having to deal with additional pressure of emergencies such as mine i certainly will not be complaining about the waiting times again incidentally i witnessed amazing kindness to dogs and owners of those waiting offering drinks and updates from the reception team thank you to all team southampton x

my dog has been seen by 4 different vets in the last few weeks but that is fine at least you get different views the problem is that you have to wait over an hour to be seen even if you are the only one waiting the vet sort out your waiting times and let your receptionists keep your customers informed while they wait

id like to share our experience with the vet hengrove as a word of warning to anyone considering joining this practice we joined last year after adopting our rescue puppy vida as it was a bit cheaper than the local vets so we thought we would register her there a few months later vida was struck by a car whilst out on a walk luckily she ran into the side of it rather than going under it we rushed her to an emergency vet where they looked after her and after a few hours we took her home and monitored her overnight the next morning we took her to the vet hengrove where she was examined by one of the vets we were worried that she had broken her front right leg as she was limping on it quite badly the vet examined her swollen leg and told us that she thought it wasnt broken we were surprised but also relieved to hear this at no point did she ask for a second opinion or suggest xrays in fact i asked her if it was worth getting xrays which she said you can but i dont think its necessary it doesnt feel broken given we had only taken out insurance that week we were not covered for any of this and given the hundreds of pounds it costs and the words of reassurance from the vet we decided not to the dog was clearly limping but was also using the leg the vet told us not to stop her from using the leg so thats what we did we let her use the leg and after a week the swelling had gone down and we could see there was something very wrong there was a big bump in her leg where the bones were clearly broken we took her back to the vets where they took xrays and confirmed it was broken but by this point she had been running around the house on the vets advise for a week eventually after feeling like we were being let down we spoke to the head vet sophie she explained that the vet we saw didnt think it was broken and she had the dogs best interest at heart ive no doubt thats the truth but we relied on them as the experts to make the correct assessment and if there was any doubt in her mind then she should have suggested we have the leg xrayed sophie was unprepared to take any responsibility for the mistakes her team had made  at this point we just wanted to fix the situation as best we could as the leg was healing wonky this involved them putting her leg in a splint for several weeks which ended up rubbing all the fur off her leg and cutting deep into her flesh eventually they stopped putting her leg in a splint we then spent several hundreds of pounds on further xrays and scans to find out the severity of the problem and weather it would require surgery after an inconclusive diagnosis we had to wait a further few months pay hundreds of pounds more for further scans and await the results of that the entire time we felt like we were being sent from pillar to post seeing different vets each time without ever seeing a specialist  during this time there were several issues with them not contacting me when they said they would with results i would eventually phone back and would be told on numerous occasions that they had left me a message when they had not after a while i asked them to read back the numbers they had and they had 3 phone numbers mine my girlfriends and a completely random number nothing to do with us that they had clearly been leaving messages on for weeks sometimes the xrays would be late and rather than informing us we would have to phone them i began to find the level of incompetence frustrating and inexcusable after spending thousands of pounds we were told that the dog wouldnt need surgery and could live with the now reformed bent leg after this we began to notice the leg was continuing to bow so took her to another vet for a second opinion they were clear just from looking at it that it would require surgery and we were referred to highcroft referrals vida ended up having to have a very serious and extremely expensive operation where her leg had to be rebroken and a metal plate four inches long screwed into her bone following this was 8 weeks of having to look after a dog with a broken leg both of us sleeping on a mattress on the floor in the living room as the dog had to be crate bound or on a leash in a room without furniture so she couldnt run or jump even days before her surgery despite several attempts from highcroft to retrieve her xrays from the vet noone ever sent them over we had photos of them on our phone that we had to provide the surgeon how ridiculous  the toll this took on us emotionally and financially was great we had to take time off work we had to deal with all the stresses and upset of months of seeing our dog in pain and discomfort as well as the total bill after surgery scans and appointments coming in at 8000 all of this could and should have been avoided if the original vet hadnt misdiagnosed her injury the stream of further mistakes makes the whole thing inexcusable we have been left to feel very upset and angry about the situation our focus since has been on the dog thankfully she is now fit and well again and we have her registered at highcroft who have been fantastic now that we have dealt with the immediate situation we are looking into taking legal action against the vet to cover the financial costs involved as it stands we havent even had an apology
the vet have been looking after our dog brandy for approx3yrs now  he has always recieved great care  would reccomend any pet owner to use this brilliant service

i cant thank the team at the vet enough for being so amazing during such a heartbreaking time for me my little holly unfortunately had to get put to sleep on friday which we were not expecting at all when we picked her up however the senior veterinary surgeon spoke to us with great patience and explained everything so calmy and so well to help me make the right choice my beautiful dog passed away peacefully and i was allowed to sit and hold her afterwards for as long as i needed by the time i left the surgery it was almost 10pm but still the team were incredible very sensitive to the situation and very sympathetic i picked hollys body and her clay paw print up today and was once again met with great patience even though my situation was extremely difficult the vet made it as comfortable as possible thank you thank you so very much

the vets  southampton  our first experience was getting our cat harveys first vaccination we were told this was the best thing and was not told about any risks he developed a small lump so we took him straight back to get checked out the vet told us that it could be cancer and he should have his next vaccine but not to worry worse case scenario theyd inject him in his tail and if he developed a cancerous lump they would just chop it off  during a routine check up for our cat loma i told the vet that loma was not neutered as we were hoping she would get pregnant she looked at me with disgust raised her eyebrows and tutted at me and shook her head i explained to her that we had a plan and that we already had homes for her kittens with family members loma got pregnant much to our delight and we bought lots of kitten toys however one morning when she was heavily pregnant she had bleed and i took her straight to the vets i was told she would be seen immediately  but i had to go to the reception after 10 minutes to remind her of this promise and that my cat was bleeding the vet was the same one who i saw previously and i felt immediately a look of told you so she did an ultrasound during which a vet assistant called hope helped me hold loma hope was lovely and really calmed loma and myself she was very kind and i am so grateful that she was there the vet struggled to find kittens saying that they were really small she told me that there were 2 kittens one had a faint heart beat the other none she had to get the head vet in to double check and this vet did not talk to me about anything she saw and left immediately after looking at the scan the vet said the best thing was a c section and to be neutered i felt so presured and rushed by the vet she was saying it was the best thing and she would get infections i agreed and im now going to have to live with that guilt forever that she will never be able to have her own kittens she was filling out a form and asked had she ate and i said yes and she sighed and shook her head at the time in my painc and upset i apologised  how on earth should i have known this would happen she said that she could choke on her vomit and die in the operation so i asked her to wait a few hours before going ahead she said they would do their best for loma and her kittens i got a phone call later saying that loma was okay and that unfortunately they could not resusate her one kitten and it died i was distraught and relived that loma was okay when i arrived i saw a vet i had never seen she was very happy considering the sadness of the situation and she had no idea about what operation loma had she looked very surprised when i asked her about the kitten she had to go and ask the vet she asked if i wanted to take home the kitten and i said yes she came back with hope we named her kitten after the lovely vet assistant wrapped in an old towel and i asked can you put it in a box so she went off and came back with the towel squashed into a broken old glove box and said sorry thats all we have the towel was covered in thick black hair a dogs hair this vet gave me no information on how to care for loma i was only given a piece of paper about neutered cats thankfully i sought a different vets who went through all the infections and signs i should be looking out for before this though i reluctantly returned for her check up and was told by the male receptionist that i could not see the vet as i had no apointment when i said isnt it a non appointment vets he said its all on the website and i was dismissed the day of loosing the kitten was a very upsetting day and was awful however i do feel this was made so much worse from the vets i am upset and angry that i was rushed and given the impression that neutering was the only option for our cat that we have since been told that this was not required we will not be returning to the vets and i will be telling my family and friends to avoid this vets

im not one to slander my own beautiful precious cat but audrey can sometimes be more than a little unpleasant to me  let alone strangers on her last trip to the vet she had been hissing and so was covered with a towel which escalated to biting and left the vet quite nervous of her despite our claims that she wasnt usually this foul the ordeal left me hesitant of stuffing her back into a crate for another trip fearing further distress to her and injuries to myself  i received notification that audrey was due her annual booster and rang the vet bristol for some advice on how to proceed they ellie very helpfully and kindly suggested ordering feliway spray to use on the crate for a day in advance of bringing her to the surgery they also gave her a prebooked appointment and access to a cat friendly room for 20 minutes beforehand so she could acclimate and calm down post car trip prior to the vet prodding poking and eventually needle jabbing  we have just returned from the surgery and you wouldnt believe it was the same cat i took to the vets a few months ago the steps they suggested and the lengths they went to accommodate her anxiety meant that when it came to lynsey examining her she was perfectly calm and relaxed she didnt flinch at the needle and she even put herself back into her carry crate  would recommend the bristol branch to anyone if they can calm and treat that unpleasant cow then they can definitely help your pet

the claim the invoice relates to february animal friends said you havent responded to there request to send the correct invoice  what is going on here  the claim is for over 100  this is total madness  gross incompetence  regards gary  sent from my blackberry 10 smartphone from gareth barter  sent thursday 12 july 2018 1906  to gary burnett  subject re insurance claims via the vet  dear gary  we in no way believe its acceptable to ignore any of our customers and i can only apologise to you that you have experienced a poor level of communication and service from us and that the insurance issue
